results.title: Some like it rough
results.creator_credit: British and American Forces for the Ministry of Information, Lewis Grant Wallace and Richard Massingham
results.brief_description: An American and a British soldier meet by chance and very soon begin to argue about the relative merits, especially the “toughness” of British rugger and American gridiron football. Each man then takes part in the game played by the other man’s fellow-countrymen, and from this experiment both of them barely escape alive. Presented in a humorous fashion.

results.title: Some like it hot [DVD]
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and Billy Wilder
results.brief_description: Two jazz musicians (played brilliantly by Jack Lemmon and Tony Curtis) witness the St. Valentine’s Day Massacre and elude their gangster pursuers by disguising themselves as women and joining an all-girl band headed for Miami. Billy Wilder and I.A.L. Diamond had no doubts that they were making the funniest film of their careers when they created this superb comedy. Marilyn Monroe plays a singer in one of her best performances ever.

results.title: Some have magnetic properties
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
In this film a teacher gives egg cartons filled with magnets to the children, encouraging them to discover which have magnetic properties. Various children explore contacts with iron filings, a compass, paper clips, and numerous other objects. Freedom not to be involved is open to the children here, but they are on the whole, quite involved in the project.

results.title: Some curious experiments (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fluid Dynamics of Drag”.
Professor Ascher M. Shapiro describes experiments to show that in a certain range of speeds the drag of a sphere decreases as the speed increases; that at low speed a smooth sphere has less drag than a rough sphere, while at high speeds it is just the reverse; that stream lining reduces drag in air, but increases drag in glycerine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.

results.title: Some creatures of the Barrier Reef
results.brief_description: A study of some of the unique marine animals of the Great Barrier Reef, which is noted for the variety and vivid colouring of its fauna. Also presents a general picture of the geographical formation of the reef.
results.description: A study of some of the unique marine animals of the Great Barrier Reef, which is noted for the variety and vivid colouring of its fauna. Also presents a general picture of the geographical formation of the reef.

results.title: Some call it progress (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells and Tina Viljoen
results.brief_description: The problems of inner city redevelopment. Change has become the hallmark of older cities, as old buildings are demolished to make way for the new high-rise edifices of today’s developers. However many citizens are appalled by the change and have formed Citizens Actions Groups to let the administrative officers know of their opposition. Details of some action groups are shown in Sydney, Montreal and Brussels

results.title: Some call it progress
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells and Tina Viljoen
results.brief_description: The wrecking-ball is a most effective instrument of change. It levels buildings to permit the construction of highrises and freeways. Slowly, the sense of identity that people feel in places inherited from the past is being shattered by the drive to modernize. This film chooses looks at Montreal, Brussels & Sydney, where unrestricted development has been resisted with varying degrees of success. Voice and narration by Bronwyn Drainie.
